metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2211 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in libguestfs. This issue occurs while calculating the greatest possible number of matching keys in the get_keys() function. This flaw leads to a denial of service, either by mistake or malicious actor.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-guestfs-1.0 - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
guestfish - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
guestfsd - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
guestmount - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-gfs2 - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-gobject-1.0-0 - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-hfsplus - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-java - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-jfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-nilfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-ocaml - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-perl - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-reiserfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-rescue - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-rsync - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-tools - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-xfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs-zfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
libguestfs0 - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
lua-guestfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
php-guestfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
python3-guestfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
ruby-guestfs - 1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: guestfs-tools package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
libguestfs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.46.2-10ubuntu3').
